page.title: 06PARKGATE SCHOOL SUMMER FAYRE
page.content: On{Saturday}15th{June}1985 Parkgate School{Summer Fayre}was opened at{half {past two}by the Mayor. Every year there is a Summer Fayre with a fancy dress competition, stalls, a{barbecue, raffles and{entertainment. Some of the{stalls}were soft toys, a tombola, a white elephant, a coconut shy, crazy crocks, astra glide, chuck a sponge, skittles and football. There was plenty to{eat}:hamburgers or hot dogs (sausages) with tomato sauce and fried onions, pancakes with syrup or jam, toffee apples, candy floss, ice cream, cakes and crips, also tea or coffee. There was a{cowboy}who asked a girl to hold a piece of paper in her hand and kneel down. Then he tore the paper with a whip. He asked a boy to put some protective gloves on and hold a balloon. He fired a gun to burst it.
